extendedInfo.description: Mahjong and Friends(MJ&F) is a traditional Mahjong(éº»é/éº»å°/éº»å°) game based on the Mahjong Competition Rules(MCR) introduced by The World Mahjong Organization. The game features all 81 types of Mahjong Hands defined in the rules. MJ&F supports multiplayer through either Bluetooth(*1) or TCP(Intranet/Internet/Wifi/Hotspot(*2)), 2-player is supported in Free version.*1) Bluetooth game requires Android 2.1+.*2) Hosting a "Hotspot" game requires Android 2.2+.MJ&F supports in-game auto save. So that you don't have to worry about losing your game state on a transportation rush.What's more, it features a record logging system that records all of the Mahjong Hands you achieved during your day-to-day game-play.Want others know you've won with a "Big Four Winds" Mahjong Hand? No problem! You can always use the Capture feature to take result screenshot and save it to the SD storage, or use the Share feature to submit the screenshot to your favorite social network.*If you like the game, you may consider to purchase full version, full version have no Ads; unlocks 4 players network mode; statistics up to 5 levels(1 level in Free version); 4/8/16/32/48/64 hands per game selectable; minimum winning points can be set to 0/2/4/6/8 points. Thanks for your support.**When playing in network mode, ALWAYS use the same versions for all devices.***dear all, please noted that Bluetooth is a short distance communication technology, it needs both devices in short distance(e.g. within 3 meters) to establish a connection.(*update maybe frequent sometimes, please turn on auto-update if you feel this harassing, always check change log to see what's being updated and decide whether to apply, thanks!)Change Log:==========1.1.18A. reviews.title: Not enough \"points\" to \"win\"
reviews.comment: This game is very fun and I like to play.  It\'s also frustrating.  Drawing a winning tile means \"NOTHING\" if you don\'t have enough \"points\" to win.  This happens all the time.  Even if you continue to draw a winning tile, you still CAN\'T win if you don\'t have enough points to win.  Very \"Catch 22\" !!  Very FRUSTRATING.  I play traditional mahjong routinely and have never heard of this rule.  If not for this, what I call \"dumb\" rule, I would give a 5-star rating.

reviews.title: Like it BUT...
reviews.comment: Enjoy playing this game. However there\'s a flaw. At least three times I had a winning hand but the app wouldn\'t let me win. I actually had to discard the winning tile to continue. Then with each successive turn, it kept telling me that the tile I discarded is the winning tile I need! Need to be able to lower the minimum points or to opt out of that option.
